Articles.Content:
Hello, KSP forums! My name is David, long time lurker and your personal grammar nazi! Nah, Iâ€™m just joking. English isn\'t even my first language! I\'m actually Swedish, so please pardon any annoying mistakes.

I\'ve been playing KSP for a while after discovering it through the one and only Robbaz, and I really love it. It\'s just my type of game, and it has that beautiful combination of science and silliness that an astronomy geek like myself wants. Like Orbiter, but fun!

Like many on this forum, I have very high expectations for KSPâ€™s future. So many things to do, so many sights to see, and so many places to visit, no matter what horrible conditions our adorable little Kerbals may have to endure in the process! I must say Iâ€™m very impressed by your teamâ€™s accomplishments so far, and I\'m sure that you will both surpass and meet all of my expectations! In that order.

Like most others, I look forward to the day when 0.16 is released in all its glory, which will be the day when my intrepid Kerbals finally get to step out onto the barren surface of the Mun, make their long and hard journeys worthwhile, and show that fine regolith whoâ€™s the king! It will be glorious, but nowhere near as glorious as the day when you provide us with more planets to visit and explore. After all, more planets mean more regolith to dominate, decorate, and annihilate!

Body by body, both Kerbal and celestial, I shall conquer the Kerbol system. Megamile by megamile I shall make Phileas Fogg look like a wimp, and bite by bite I shall eat the Kraken for breakfast, and its buggy offspring for lunch! It will be glorious.

Until this glorious future transforms into a new present, however, I will just sit back, lurk the forum some more, and maybe produce some fanart. I havenâ€™t drawn in a while, now that I think about it.

At least I have now completed this beginner\'s rite of passage and made my presence known, so that will be it for now. See ya in the shadows, posters and fellow lurkers!

... And here\'s a picture of one of my fearless, unmanned probes, standing on the surface of the Mun. Enjoy!

Uploaded with ImageShack.us

Hello there! Everyone who\'s joining recently seems to be from places I\'ve visited in the last 5 years! I was really impressed by Sweden (Stockholm) especially the old town with the streets so narrow you have to squeeze through!

Welcome to the KSP Forums!

Happy Launching!

Arrr!

Capt\'n Skunky

KSP Community Manager

Hello there! Everyone who\'s joining recently seems to be from places I\'ve visited in the last 5 years! I was really impressed by Sweden (Stockholm) especially the old town with the streets so narrow you have to squeeze through!

Oh, dear. It\'s a conspiracy! Haha, no but I\'m glad you liked it. It\'s an interesting city indeed.

Now, my unmatched lurking skills tell me that you\'re from the UK, nice! I\'ve never been there myself, but it\'s on my list of places I want to visit sometime!

Hey, another Swede! VÃ¤lkommen ^^

Yes! Another viking brought here by the great Robbaz, I presume? Tack sÃ¥ mycket!
